content:
Change this text into a rap: Once upon a time, a farmer had a goose that laid one golden egg every day. The egg provided enough money for the farmer and his wife to support their daily needs. The farmer and his wife continued to be happy for a long time.

But, one day, the farmer thought, “Why should we take just one egg a day? Why can’t we take them all at once and make a lot of money?” The farmer told his wife his idea, and she foolishly agreed.

Then, the next day, as the goose laid its golden egg, the farmer was quick with a sharp knife. He killed the goose and cut its stomach open, hoping to find all its golden eggs. But as he opened the stomach, he only found guts and blood.

The farmer quickly realized his foolish mistake and proceeded to cry over his lost resource. As the days went on, the farmer and his wife became poorer and poorer because of their foolishness.

chosen:
Verse 1:
Once upon a time, in a small town,
A farmer had a goose that laid a golden crown,
One egg each day, it was quite a treat,
Enough for him and his wife to eat and beat the heat.

Chorus:
But greed got the best of him, oh no!
He wanted all the gold, but it wouldn't grow,
With one swift move, he took the goose by surprise,
And ended up with nothing but tears in his eyes.

Verse 2:
The goose was gone, and so was the gold,
No more riches, they were left to get old,
Poverty struck like a bolt from the blue,
They couldn't believe what they did, it was true.

Chorus:
Greed is the thief that will steal your joy,
It takes away dreams like a hungry boy,
Don't let it win, you have to try,
Stay humble, my friend, or you'll also cry.

Bridge:
So listen closely, dear friends of mine,
This tale may seem simple, but it holds a valuable sign,
Contentment is key, don't seek wealth in vain,
For happiness lies not in treasures, but in our hearts remain.
rejected:
Verse 1:
Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a farmer and his wife,
They were content with life, but always looking for more,
A goose that lays golden eggs, seemed like a dream come true,
Every day they got richer, without having to do much,

Chorus:
But greed got the best of them, they couldn't resist,
Taking all the eggs at once, instead of being patient,
It wasn't long before their luck ran dry,
And their foolishness led to a lifetime of sorrow and sighs,

Verse 2:
The farmer sharpened his knife, ready to strike gold,
He slit the goose's belly open, but what he saw made him cold,
No golden eggs inside, just guts and blood and tears,
His dreams of wealth vanished, leaving him full of fears,

Chorus:
But greed got the best of them, they couldn't resist,
Taking all the eggs at once, instead of being patient,
It wasn't long before their luck ran dry,
And their foolishness led to a lifetime of sorrow and sighs,

Bridge:
Now the farmer and his wife live in poverty,
Their foolish choice haunting them constantly,
They could have been rich, if only they had waited,
Instead they learned the hard way, the price of their fate,

Chorus:
But greed got the best of them, they couldn't resist,
Taking all the eggs at once, instead of being patient,
It wasn't long before their luck ran dry,
And their foolishness led to a lifetime of sorrow and sighs,

Outro:
